newsitem.title: INDIA: Guerrillas kill seven Indian soldiers.
newsitem.headline: Guerrillas kill seven Indian soldiers.

text.p: At least seven Indian security personnel were killed and four injured in an ambush by separatist guerrillas on Saturday in the northeastern state of Manipur, police said.
They said the guerrillas ambushed the security vehicle near Nambol police station in Imphal district.

The northeast is linked to the rest of India only by a narrow strip of land passing north of Bangladesh. Five of the seven states, Manipur, Nagaland, Assam, Tripura and Mizoram, have been hit by insurgency movements.
Dozens of guerrilla groups have been fighting for independent homelands.
